text:
Hi LL,
Another merchant is using my brand name as a keyword and is clearly violating the keyword spam policy.  I have flagged each listing months back and you have not delisted the items.    This is (a) frustrating for customers legtimally searching for Scarlet Creative and (b) is a long time to leave listings in violation up without resolution.
Can I ask you remove my brand name from their keywords as they do not have permission to use or resolve it with the merchant with delisting/normal approach you take for flagged items.  You will note I am not the only brand they use in their keywords, they use Dust Bunny, Inverse etc etc.
Here are the items concerned so you can see I have flagged them some time back and no action has been taken.
LINKS REMOVED BY ME FOR PASTING
Image showing I already flagged this some time back
LINKS REMOVED BY ME FOR PASTING

Per TOS:
"Keyword spam is the use of words (such as brand names, item names, or other terms) that have nothing to do with the item listed so that the listing will appear in search results. Keyword spam is not allowed because it clutters the SL Marketplace and makes buying and selling more difficult. In addition"

Thanks so much!



Jagix Linden
said about 7 hours ago
Hello Charlotte Bartlett,

Thank you for contacting Linden Lab Support. We understand your concern regarding the Second Life Marketplace listings. If you believe the listings violate the Second Life Marketplace Listing Guidelines or the Second Life Terms of Service, please flag them for review. 

Second Life Marketplace Listing Guidelines: https://marketplace.secondlife.com/listing_guidelines

Second Life Terms of Service: http://lindenlab.com/tos

Flagging the item will allow our Marketplace team to review the listings further. You may find the below information useful regarding how to flag a listing.  
http://community.secondlife.com/t5/English-Knowledge-Base/Shopping-in-the-Second-Life-Marketplace/ta-p/700189#Section_.3

Locate the listing. 
On the right side, click Flag this item. 
In the Reason for Flag drop-down, please select a reason.  
In the Detailed Reason drop-down, please select a reason.  
Click Flag. 

If you have further questions regarding this topic, please feel free to respond back to this ticket. For all other questions, please submit a new support ticket. 

Best Regards, 

Jagix Linden
Account Specialist 
Linden Lab


Charlotte Bartlett
said about 3 hours ago
Hi please see my comments above (please see my original ticket above) you will note these HAVE been flagged for an excessive amount of time.

You need to remove my brand name with immediate effect.

Thanks so much

Jagix Linden
said about 1 hour ago
Hello Charlotte Bartlett,

Please be advised that, due to privacy concerns, we cannot comment on the results of your Flags. Per our previous message to you, flagging the item will allow our Marketplace team to review the listings further. You may find the below information useful regarding how to flag a listing.  
http://community.secondlife.com/t5/English-Knowledge-Base/Shopping-in-the-Second-Life-Marketplace/ta-p/700189#Section_.3

Locate the listing. 
On the right side, click Flag this item. 
In the Reason for Flag drop-down, please select a reason.  
In the Detailed Reason drop-down, please select a reason.  
Click Flag. 

If you have further questions regarding this topic, please feel free to respond back to this ticket. For all other questions, please submit a new support ticket. 

Best Regards, 

Jagix Linden
Account Specialist 
Linden Lab
